page.title: 05GROVE HOUSE
page.content: { Grove House}is to be found on Skipton Road immediately to the north of the Harrogate-Starbeck railway line. On this site was once an inn called "The World's End" and later an academy for boys. It was rebuilt by{Samson Fox}one of the people to whom Harrogate owes its' prosperity and was the Victorian equivalent of a Baronial Hall. In 1926 it was purchased by the Royal Antedeluvian Order of Buffaloes{ {R.A.O.B.}and is still today used as a Convalescent Home for the members of that society.
